@SeanTrende I was just paraphrasing a phone conversation between Trump and Carter which Trump praised and where Carter made these points. https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2019/04/16/trump-chats-jimmy-carter-china-claims-he-always-like-him/3483656002/

@SeanTrende My point is instead of investing trillions in wars we should be investing in science, technology, education here at home. We need to have a sputnik like mentality to make sure our system of government remains the model for the world.

@SeanTrende I like your writing on realclear politics. I just want to be clear. I believe American democracy and free enterprise is much better than China‚Äôs authoritarian capitalism. But China has not been in endless wars and is making investments in critical technologies and infrastructure.

@FrankLuntz In SV, we have a saying: Only the paranoid survive. @FrankLuntz I rather we not underestimate the Chinese. We both believe in the exceptionalism of American values. Let‚Äôs find common cause on stopping bad wars and making the investments necessary so America wins the 21st century.

@FrankLuntz I am not arguing for anything knew. It‚Äôs the Hamiltonian view that propelled America into a world power. It‚Äôs Lincoln with Land Grant Universities. It‚Äôs our Sputnik mentality that led to so much of the technology in my district in Silicon Valley.

@FrankLuntz But we need as Americans to find a common purpose and make the investments we need to succeed in a technology revolution. My only point is that infrastructure, broadband, NSF, NIH, DARPA, clean energy, education should be seen as bipartisan priorities to win the 21st century.

@FrankLuntz Agree @FrankLuntz. That‚Äôs what is concerning. We know we can beat fascism and communism. But we have never been tested by authoritarian capitalism (China‚Äôs system). I would much rather live in our messy democracy that values rights and freedoms...

RT @Quillette ‚ÄúHigher education has become a transfer of wealth from the future earnings of the aspirational lower and middle classes to a metastasising administrative parasite.‚Äù https://quillette.com/2019/05/09/after-academia/

@FrankLuntz 5/5 Final point. I actually enjoying your commentary @FrankLuntz even when we disagree. You are smart to talk about economic freedom instead of a type of capitalism that privileges the rich and connected. I welcome a longer conversation!

@FrankLuntz 4/4 This point was not even an attack on Trump. It was more a sense of what we as Americans must do to make sure that free enterprise democracy prevails and not China‚Äôs authoritarian capitalism with censorship. On this issue, @FrankLuntz all Americans should be on the same team.

@FrankLuntz 3/3 We didn‚Äôt win the Cold War by complacency. We were fueled by Sputnik. We shouldn‚Äôt seek a new Cold War with China. But we should make sure we are investing in the critical technology and infrastructure to win in the 21st century.

@FrankLuntz 2/2 They haven‚Äôt engaged in military interventionism. If they are our primary competition, we should make sure we outcompete them in infrastructure, artificial intelligence, green energy, education. My point was simply that we should end bad wars and invest in our people!

@FrankLuntz 1/1) I appreciate the back and forth. I am not elevating them in anyway. My concern is that China doesn‚Äôt win the 21st century with authoritarian capitalism. Our values are better. But they are being strategic in their investments. We can‚Äôt be complacent...

@FrankLuntz @samvega I categorically believe America treats our citizens better than the Chinese and has a better government. Mr. Luntz, do you agree with Carter & Trump that endless wars in places like Iraq are a disaster & we should invest trillions instead in infrastructure & education?
